properties.name: Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577parisThe Effil Tower is a 1,000 ft. giant peace of art,built 100 years after the french revolution it was built for no purpose other than to say look what we can build. It was built by a bridge builder named Gustave Effil and his work was a marvel for the time. And to think all he needed was 7000 tons of metal and 50 tons of paint, but no every one thought it to be so great. A righter named Guy de Maupassant ate lunch in the tower just so he wouldn\'t have to look at it.

properties.name: Eurostar train
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577LondonThe fastest way to get from the Eiffel Tower to Big Ben is on a train track,it is a conjunction of railroads that zips you and up to 800 other people from downtown London to downtown Paris. And you can do this with out even having your ears popped or you and your family stuffed in a car. Although your ears wont pop like a airplane ride as I said before you may want to check in 30 to 45 minutes in advace at the Gare du Nord. You have to go through a airport like security, show your pass port and look at a t.v. to see where you get on. You\'ll also find a few gift shops, snack bars and coffee shops along the way.

properties.name: Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577AirazoniaThis is a giant goarge carved by the Colorado River, it is also homed by one of the first National Parks in the U.S. with a not so surprising name Grand Canyon National Park. The canyon is 227 miles long and have a vering width of 4 to 18 miles. During North Americas eirly years a group of indians called the Pueblo people settled in the massive cut in the earths surface and considerd it holy ground.

properties.name: Great Pyramid Of Giza
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577 This is defenitly one of the oldest pyramids no to man and possibly one of the first. It was believed that here the dead pharos could step up the side of the structure to the top and in the prosses assend to heaven. the structure was built around a 20 year period around 2560 BC, and it is believed by most that it was built for a single Pharo named Khufu.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577harrisburg pennsylvania Tradition tells of a chime that changed the world on July, 1776, with the Liberty Bell ringing out from the tower of Independence Hall calling the citizens of Philadelphia to hear the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence by John Nixon. The Assembly ordered the Bell in 1751 to commemorate the 50 year anniversary of William Penn\'s 1701 Charter of Privileges. Pennsylvania\'s original Constitution. It speaks of the rights and freedoms.

properties.name: Lincoln Memoral
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577Washington D.C.Abraham Lincoln the 16th President is and was not only a great leader for this country but also a great individual. His nickname was honest Abe and he was the man who kept this country together, so it is no surprise that this memorial was built after his assassination.

properties.name: Mongolian Grill
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577town center drive lakeland FL

properties.name: Niagra Falls
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577canadaone of the greatest and larger water falls in the world not to mention the fact that its the most visited falls, divided into two section horseshue falls and american falls one being 178 feet tall and the other being 70 All together, Niagara\'s electical plants can produce about 4.4 GW of power. like the robert moses niagara powerplant and the lewison pump generating plant on the American side, along with Sir Adam Beck 1 and 2 on the Canadian side.

properties.name: Pearl Harbor Hawaii
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577pearl harbor hawaiiI think Paerl Harbor is a big part of American history. On December 7, 1941 Japanese bombers attacked this harbor with 353 Japanese aircrafts. Although the major fuel storage cells were not damaged in the attack US had severe casualties. About 2,338 people both military and citizens lost their lives this day, and around 1,178 were left wounded. The Japanese attackers suffered minimal losses at around 65 servicemen.

properties.name: The Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577ChinaThe Chineese Wall also know as Chángchéng which means "long wall," which is actually made of multibly walls protecting the N.E. section of china. It stretches to over 6,700 km 4,160 miles in total with all the walls put together. When the wall was in use it was garded by well over one million men, and the wall was built to protect attackers with sword and spears so the it was simply made with stone and dirt stamped over boards of wood.

properties.name: iguazu falls
properties.description: Posted by Themuffinman577brazil Taller than Niagara Falls, and at the same time twice as wide, the Falls were created by a volcanic eruption which left another big crack in the earth. I think not only would it be great to see such a large land form that only God could make real, but i think it would also blow me away to see such a land structure. The falls can be reached from the two main towns on either side of the falls. "Foz do Iguaçu" in the Brazilian state of Paraná, and "Puerto Iguazú" in the Argentine province of Misiones.
